alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 4:44AM MST until February 17 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches. Greater amounts near three inches likely along and east of Tramway. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area. * WHEN...Until Noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40 and I-25. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
